titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an Rush Rhees, 26. 5. 1948
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original an der ÖNB (Autogr. 1286/19-4); Kopie im BA.

div.p: Thanks for your letter & the cutting. What an institution that Church of England is!! ‒ Yes, the weather has been marvellous the last fortnight or so, but though the sun's shining it's pretty cold. ‒ I, too, am glad that v. Wright was elected. ‒ I'm moderately well though I get tired (especially mentally) all too easily. Doing my housework keeps me sane. Drury, whome I saw in Dublin recently, sends his very best wishes.
I hope to see you sometime in the summer.
